name: Bulbasaur
legend: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

name: Ivysaur
legend: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

name: Venusaur
legend: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.

name: Charmander
legend: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

name: Charmeleon
legend: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

name: Charizard
legend: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.

name: Squirtle
legend: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

name: Wartortle
legend: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

name: Blastoise
legend: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.

name: Caterpie
legend: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

name: Metapod
legend: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.

name: Butterfree
legend: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

name: Weedle
legend: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

name: Kakuna
legend: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

name: Beedrill
legend: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

name: Pidgey
legend: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

name: Pidgeotto
legend: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

name: Pidgeot
legend: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

name: Rattata
legend: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

name: Raticate
legend: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

name: Spearow
legend: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

name: Fearow
legend: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

name: Ekans
legend: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

name: Arbok
legend: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

name: Pikachu
legend: When Pikachu meet, they’ll touch their tails together and exchange electricity through them as a form of greeting.

name: Raichu
legend: If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.

name: Sandshrew
legend: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

name: Sandslash
legend: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

name: Nidoran♀
legend: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.

name: Nidorina
legend: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

name: Nidoqueen
legend: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

name: Nidoran♂
legend: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.

name: Nidorino
legend: It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

name: Nidoking
legend: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

name: Clefairy
legend: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

name: Clefable
legend: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they’re usually found in quiet places.

name: Vulpix
legend: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

name: Ninetales
legend: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

name: Jigglypuff
legend: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.

name: Wigglytuff
legend: It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that’s perfectly heavenly.

name: Zubat
legend: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.

name: Golbat
legend: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.

name: Oddish
legend: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

name: Gloom
legend: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

name: Vileplume
legend: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

name: Paras
legend: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

name: Parasect
legend: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

name: Venonat
legend: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

name: Venomoth
legend: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

name: Diglett
legend: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

name: Dugtrio
legend: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it’s like underground.

name: Meowth
legend: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.

name: Persian
legend: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.

name: Psyduck
legend: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.

name: Golduck
legend: Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into the water and taken away.

name: Mankey
legend: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

name: Primeape
legend: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

name: Growlithe
legend: Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.

name: Arcanine
legend: A Pokémon that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

name: Poliwag
legend: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

name: Poliwhirl
legend: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.

name: Poliwrath
legend: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

name: Abra
legend: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.

name: Kadabra
legend: This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.

name: Alakazam
legend: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.

name: Machop
legend: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

name: Machoke
legend: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

name: Machamp
legend: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.

name: Bellsprout
legend: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

name: Weepinbell
legend: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

name: Victreebel
legend: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

name: Tentacool
legend: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.

name: Tentacruel
legend: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.

name: Geodude
legend: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

name: Graveler
legend: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

name: Golem
legend: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.

name: Ponyta
legend: If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.

name: Rapidash
legend: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.

name: Slowpoke
legend: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.

name: Slowbro
legend: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.

name: Magnemite
legend: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.

name: Magneton
legend: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.

name: Farfetch'd
legend: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

name: Doduo
legend: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

name: Dodrio
legend: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

name: Seel
legend: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Dewgong
legend: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

name: Grimer
legend: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

name: Muk
legend: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

name: Shellder
legend: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

name: Cloyster
legend: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.

name: Gastly
legend: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

name: Haunter
legend: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.

name: Gengar
legend: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.

name: Onix
legend: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

name: Drowzee
legend: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

name: Hypno
legend: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

name: Krabby
legend: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

name: Kingler
legend: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

name: Voltorb
legend: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

name: Electrode
legend: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.

name: Exeggcute
legend: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

name: Exeggutor
legend: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

name: Cubone
legend: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

name: Marowak
legend: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

name: Hitmonlee
legend: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

name: Hitmonchan
legend: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

name: Lickitung
legend: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.

name: Koffing
legend: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.

name: Weezing
legend: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.

name: Rhyhorn
legend: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

name: Rhydon
legend: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Chansey
legend: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.

name: Tangela
legend: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.

name: Kangaskhan
legend: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

name: Horsea
legend: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

name: Seadra
legend: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.

name: Goldeen
legend: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

name: Seaking
legend: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

name: Staryu
legend: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

name: Starmie
legend: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

name: Mr. Mime
legend: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

name: Scyther
legend: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you've found is a Scyther's territory.

name: Jynx
legend: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.

name: Electabuzz
legend: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.

name: Magmar
legend: These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.

name: Pinsir
legend: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.

name: Tauros
legend: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.

name: Magikarp
legend: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.

name: Gyarados
legend: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

name: Lapras
legend: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

name: Ditto
legend: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.

name: Eevee
legend: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

name: Vaporeon
legend: Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the molecular composition of water. It can melt invisibly in water.

name: Jolteon
legend: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

name: Flareon
legend: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Porygon
legend: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.

name: Omanyte
legend: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.

name: Omastar
legend: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.

name: Kabuto
legend: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.

name: Kabutops
legend: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.

name: Aerodactyl
legend: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

name: Snorlax
legend: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

name: Articuno
legend: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.

name: Zapdos
legend: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.

name: Moltres
legend: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

name: Dratini
legend: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.

name: Dragonair
legend: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.

name: Dragonite
legend: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.

name: Mewtwo
legend: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

name: Mew
legend: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
